questions.question_text:
An administrator needs to add capability to perform real time signature lookups to block or sinkhole all known malware domains.
Which type of single, unified engine will get this result?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://www.paloguard.com/Content-ID.asp#:~:text=Content%2DID%20gives%20you%20a,exploits%2C%20malware%20and%20malware%20communications
https://subscription.packtpub.com/book/cloud-and-networking/9781789956375/2/ch02lvl1sec05/understanding-app-id-and-content-id#:~:text=App%2DID%20and%20Content%2DID%20are%20two%20technologies%20that%20go,and%20data%20exfiltration%20is%20prevented.

Content-ID gives you a real-time threat prevention engine, combined with a comprehensive URL database, and elements of application identification to:

Limit unauthorized data and file transfers
Detect and block exploits, malware and malware communications
Control unapproved web surfing

I believe the answer here is Content ID

The capability to perform real-time signature lookups to block or sinkhole all known malware domains is provided by the Content ID engine12345.

Content ID is a threat prevention engine that uses multiple methods to detect and prevent threats at all points of the attack lifecycle1. It includes capabilities such as WildFire, which performs real-time signature lookups12345.

Therefore, the correct answer is A. Content ID.

Selected Answer: A
Security Processing doesn't have signature matching feature which is asked in the question.
https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/resources/pa-series-next-generation-firewalls-hardware-architectures.
There's Network Processor, Security Processor, Offload/Signature Matching Processor, and Management Processor.
The Security Processing Engine has APP-ID | User-ID | URL match | policy match app decoding | SSL/IPSec | decompression functions.
The Signature Matching Processor has Exploits | Virus | Spyware | CC# | SSN functions.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
Content-IDTM combines a real-time threat prevention engine with a
comprehensive URL database and elements of application identification
to limit unauthorized data and file transfers and detect and block a wide
range of exploits, malware, dangerous web surfing as well as targeted
and unknown threats.
https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/content/dam/pan/en_US/assets/pdf/tech-briefs/techbrief-content-id.pdf

questions.question_text: Which action would an administrator take to ensure that a service object will be available only to the selected device group?

choices.A: ensure that disable override is selected
choices.D: create the service object in the specific template
choices.C: ensure that disable override is cleared

discussion.content: b- When creating an object in a particular Device Group, do not check the "Shared" checkbox. This will keep the objects only in that Device Group and not send them to devices outside the group.

Selected Answer: B
https://knowledgebase.paloaltonetworks.com/KCSArticleDetail?id=kA10g000000Cm1tCAC

answer is B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/panorama/11-0/panorama-admin/manage-firewalls/manage-device-groups/create-objects-for-use-in-shared-or-device-group-policy

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B 

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-web-interface-help/objects/objects-services

Selected Answer: B
uncheck the shared when creating object

questions.question_text: Which built-in IP address EDL would be useful for preventing traffic from IP addresses that are verified as unsafe based on WildFire analysis, Unit 42 research, and data gathered from telemetry?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-0/pan-os-admin/policy/use-an-external-dynamic-list-in-policy/built-in-edls

Palo Alto Networks Known Malicious IP Addresses—Contains IP addresses that are verified malicious based on WildFire analysis, Unit 42 research, and data gathered from telemetry (share threat intelligence with Palo Alto Networks). Attackers use these IP addresses almost exclusively to distribute malware, initiate command-and-control activity, and launch attacks.

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/policy/use-an-external-dynamic-list-in-policy/built-in-edls

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/policy/use-an-external-dynamic-list-in-policy/built-in-edls

choices.C: Palo Alto Networks C&C IP Addresses
choices.A: Palo Alto Networks High-Risk IP Addresses
choices.D: Palo Alto Networks Bulletproof IP Addresses
choices.B: Palo Alto Networks Known Malicious IP Addresses

questions.question_text:
An administrator would like to determine the default deny action for the application dns-over-https.
Which action would yield the information?

discussion.content: To determine the default deny action for the application dns-over-https, the administrator should D. View the application details in Objects > Applications12.

Selected Answer: D
It's D

Selected Answer: D
D of course

Selected Answer: D
Deny : Blocks traffic and enforces the default ”deny” action defined for the application that is being denied. To view the default “deny” action defined for an application, display the application details in Objects > Applications
[Palo Alto Networks]

Selected Answer: D
you can view the default deny action in the application details in Objects > Applications

Selected Answer: D
That said - for all the app definitions on my palo alto i cannot see application type dns-over-https. But still i think its D

choices.A: View the application details in beacon.paloaltonetworks.com
choices.B: Check the action for the Security policy matching that traffic
choices.D: View the application details in Objects > Applications
choices.C: Check the action for the decoder in the antivirus profile

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/url-filtering/enable-advanced-url-filtering

Selected Answer: A
Palo Alto Networks URL filtering solution, the Advanced URL Filtering subscription, provides real time URL analysis and malware prevention. In addition to PAN-DB access, the Palo Alto Networks-developed URL filtering database for high-performance URL lookups, it also offers coverage against malicious URLs and IP addresses. This multi-layered protection solution is configured through your URL filtering profile.

questions.question_text: Access to which feature requires a URL Filtering license?
